race.name: Edition Zero
race.tagline: New Zealand South Island gravel adventure.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through South Island mountains. Significant elevation with mountain scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional New Zealand event. Mountainous terrain with very difficult access, high costs, and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: Edition Zero is a regional event in New Zealand's South Islandâ€”mountainous terrain with significant elevation. The New Zealand mountains are stunning and organization is solid, but the very difficult/expensive access and regional field keep it firmly in Tier 3.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A scenic New Zealand mountain gravel race. Worth it for adventure seekers with big budgets. Not practical for most international riders.

final_verdict.one_liner: New Zealand South Island gravel adventure.
final_verdict.should_you_race: If you have a big budget and want a New Zealand experienceâ€”maybe. For most ridersâ€”there are better options.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better value: regional gravel races. For similar NZ terrain: Otago Gravel.

logistics.airport: Queenstown (ZQN) or Christchurch (CHC) varies by location
logistics.lodging_strategy: South Island has good lodging options but expensive.
logistics.food: South Island has full dining options. Stock nutrition.

non_negotiables.why: New Zealand mountains require sustained effort.
New Zealand summer weather is variable.

marketplace_variables.race_hook: New Zealand South Island gravel adventure.

logistics.explanation: George Bennett, fresh off European WorldTour racing, worried about basic logistics: 'I was worried about aid stations; I was worried about getting there in time for sign on.' Drop bags collected at registration create complexity, and GPS navigation is mandatory for Mains since the course isn't fully marked. Waimate remains a small agricultural town with infrastructure challenges for mass participation events. As Unsupported Format puts it: "Given this is an adventure and people are travelling from all over to attend, this event is strictly unsupported. This means that there is no personal on course support."

length.explanation: The Mains delivers 248km of punishment that tests mental limits as much as physical. Ant described the psychological warfare: 'Whilst the 70km to the first bag drop seemed to, and in fact did, take hours, once I reached the second and final bag drop, I felt that I was nearly home even though there was still 80km left to ride.' At his longest bike ride ever, it earned that status. Longer than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego. As Anonymous rider puts it: "Strange things happen in one's mind when the distances are that long. Whilst the 70km to the first bag drop seemed to, and in fact did, take hours, once I reached the second and final bag drop, I felt..."

technicality.explanation: Riders encounter 'unexpectedly deep gravel that you wouldn't notice until your bike started to fishtail on a descent' mixed with stream crossings over 'rounded wet slippery stones.' The course demands line discipline through freshly graded sections where riders warned 'stay on your line... no one front or behind.' Multiple crashes occurred at ford crossings despite rider caution. Similar technical demands to Gravel Worlds. As Anonymous rider puts it: "As the terrain became lumpier I started to feel the odd pre-cramp twinge from repeated efforts to close gaps over the tops of the punchy ascents. On a gravel climb after c."

elevation.explanation: Three key passesâ€”Mackenzie, Hakataramea, and Meyersâ€”deliver 3,500-4,000m of climbing across 248km. Mackenzie Pass features 'an excruciating straight headwind section' before a 4km climb at 6.3% gradient. The elevation creates selection without dominating, as one rider noted it 'didn't feel that hilly overall' despite the substantial vertical gain. Similar elevation profile to Gravel Worlds. As Mackenzie Pass Details puts it: "The first major obstacle was the Mackenzie pass, a four kilometre climb with an average gradient of 6.3%."

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 56Â°F and lows of 41Â°F, with a 69% chance of rain on any given day, and gusts reaching 30 mph. New Zealand spring weather delivers extremes: '2022 we had snow on one side of the course and bright sunshine on the other!' Charlotte Clarke's pre-race recon hit winds so severe she was 'pinned by the wind against a fence, hanging on for dear life' while Caleb struggled with a bike that 'wouldn't stay upright.' Race day 2025 brought surprisingly hot conditions that eliminated drafting benefits. Similar climate challenges to SBT GRVL.

altitude.explanation: Rolling South Canterbury farmland keeps elevation gains moderate rather than oxygen-debt inducing. The three passes climb through pastoral terrain where the limiting factor remains muscular endurance, not cardiovascular adaptation. Sea-level fitness translates directlyâ€”your legs will surrender before your lungs protest the altitude. Modest altitude compared to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

adventure.explanation: 'It's 250 kilometres with no towns. There are smatterings of dairy farms, but it's limited to the very start and end of the course,' explains race founder Andy Chalmers. The route crosses pristine gravel where 'there isn't a lot of traffic going up and down the roads every day.' Finishing at the 1891 velodrome adds historical theater to the remote backcountry exploration.

prestige.explanation: 2025 Unbound winner Cam Jones targeting Edition Zero and setting a 7:24 course record signals growing credibility. Race founder Andy Chalmers noted 'This year it was very evident that people had targeted it. It wasn't just another race on their calendar. It was something they were putting specific effort towards.' International participation is building, but prestige accumulates over decades, not seasons.

race_quality.explanation: Feed zones operate like triathlon transitions where 'valuable time, or your position in a strong group, can be lost through poor planning or execution.' George Bennett discovered this when he 'dropped into the third group coming out of' the first feed zone. Early graded gravel splits fields immediately, creating tactical racing that rewards preparation and punishes hesitation. As Post-Race Scene puts it: "The post-race vibes were immaculate. Everyone was buzzing, and everyone had a story to tell."

experience.explanation: Hakataramea Pass delivers 'the nicest section of the ride. 20km of tailwind and gravity assisted fun on a smooth gravel road' before the course turns punitive again. The velodrome finish creates theaterâ€”Charlotte Clarke described 'The atmosphere inside the velodrome with the crowd was unreal.' One rider summarized it as 'stunning scenery... proper gravel course' that justifies the journey to New Zealand's remote interior.

community.explanation: Riders flying in from Netherlands and worldwide for a fourth-year New Zealand race tells you something's working. The YouTube coverage shows camaraderie, not manufactured hype. But community isn't built on international jet-setters â€” it's forged in local participation and repeat attendance, which takes time to develop properly.

field_depth.explanation: Elite participation includes George Bennett and 2025 Unbound winner Cam Jones alongside competitive local riders like Charlotte Clarke defending her title. International riders now travel specifically for Edition Zero, but field depth requires hundreds across all categories. The race attracts quality at the front and recreational challengers, though total participation numbers remain modest for a global event. As Course Surface Composition puts it: "72% of the Main (about 180km) was on gravel roads. In general these comprised of fast secure gravel or hard packed dirt, but over the course of the ride we were also treated to freshly laid, deep slow..."

value.explanation: Snack distance costs $140 early bird for aid stations with drop bag service, GPS files, and finish line festivities. The organization earns praiseâ€”one rider specifically commended being 'really well organized by Andy and his crew.' Drop bags, medics, and the historic velodrome finish justify entry fees, though international travel costs dwarf the reasonable registration price.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $150-250 NZD. Mandatory GPS navigation device, emergency blanket, and tools add equipment costs before considering Waimate logistics. International flights to reach South Canterbury, rental cars for the remote location, and limited regional accommodation options create substantial expense barriers. One rider noted needing emergency bivi blankets available at the expo, highlighting the specialized gear requirements for this remote challenge. More expensive than Atlas Mountain Race.

Highlights of the 2023 Edition Zero Gravel race based in Waimate, South Island New Zealand. The 247km 'Mains' route loops from the historic Waimate Velodrome over the McKenzie Pass, the Hakataramea Pass and Meyers Pass. 
Presented by Shimano United In Gravel.

would be unimaginable. It turned out
that Sally was the one who stole the
death chest. Yes, that Titan cat. She
treated the death chest like a toy. I
went to ask her for it back, but she
played hideand seek with me. I finally
found the death chest, but Sally had
already triggered its ultimate skill,
dark seal. She dodged it quickly and
wasn't sucked in, but I was the one who
got sucked in. And then I was trapped in
that death chest. And I'm still trapped
there today. Sam the golden dwarf
recounted in a deep muffled voice the
story of how he was tricked by Sally the
Titan cat. I didn't expect the story to
be so complicated. Fongu sighed. So
you're also going to cause trouble for
that giant cat. The golden dwarf nodded
and said although I've known it for so
many years, it really went too far this
time. I must teach it a lesson. Do you
know how to find it? Coincidentally,
we're looking for it, too. Funu laughed.
We also have a little personal grudge
against it. Upon hearing this, the
golden dwarf tentatively asked, "Then
will you kill it?" Fongu shrugged
non-committally and said, "That depends
on its attitude." By the way, I almost
forgot to ask. Is that Titan cat also
part of the dark gods faction? The
golden dwarf nodded and said, "Yes, it
also serves the darkness." Fong Yu
slapped his thigh and said, "That makes
things much easier. It seems like it was
all a misunderstanding before. Looking
back now, Fong Yu realized that when he
first met the giant cat, it never
attacked him. It only slapped away
Alpha, who had been scratching it. Now,
he thought that it must have smelled the
scent on him that was related to the
dark god, which was why it didn't make a
move. Otherwise, given my strength at
the time, even with the explosives as
cover, I wouldn't have been able to
survive that giant cat. So Fong Yu said,
"In that case, let's<unk> go find it,
teach it a lesson where it needs to be
taught a lesson, and clear up any
misunderstandings that need to be
cleared up." Upon hearing this, the
golden dwarf rose and cast a fireball
spell in front of the throne. Soon, a
huge torch ignited, followed by hundreds
of giant torches that illuminated the
entire hall. These torches were embedded
in the hands of ancient stone statues on
the halls pillars. Illuminated by the
flames of hundreds of torches, Fong Yu
finally got a good look at this
incredibly spacious underground palace.
Hundreds of stone pillars were carved
into lielike statues. The ground was
paved with huge intact stone bricks that
looked like jade, and some of them were
even engraved with mysterious ruins. At
the center of the palace was a huge
golden throne which looked like the
throne of some Titan god. After the
dwarf Sam lit the torches in the hall,
he saw the dwarf demons that had been
mutated by the parasitic seeds of the
demonic vines. He immediately frowned
and asked, "How come there are so many
dwarf demons in the dungeon? Did you
bring them?" Fongu shook his head and
said, "I killed these dwarves after I
entered the dungeon, and since I came
in, I haven't seen a second dwarf
besides you. So, so I know now, the
golden dwarf said, a hint of sorrow
flashing in his eyes. It seems these
dwarf demons must be my former people.
Huh? Fongu was stunned for a moment. He
raised an eyebrow and asked, "What do
you mean?" The Golden Dwarf said in a
deep voice. "In the demon realm, there
is a race of demons called the Demon
Soul Clan who are very good at
assimilating other races into demons,
just like the guy next to you." He
pointed to the demon vines and said,
"These dwarf demons should be the
dwarves who were assimilated by the
demon soul clan." Confused, Funu turned
to look at the demon vine and Alpha and
asked, "Is that so?" Alpha squinted and
thought for a moment before nodding.
"Movine," however, said directly.
"That's indeed true. I wouldn't have
thought of it if he hadn't mentioned
it." "Then why would there be demons in
this underground palace?" Funu asked,
puzzled. Isn't this the palace of the
titans? The golden dwarf smiled Riley
and said, "This was indeed once the
palace of the titans, but that Titan was
the dark titan, the Titan who ruled the
demon realm in the underworld.
Therefore, there is a passage to the
demon realm in this underground palace.
I think it must have been after I was
locked in the treasure chest of death
that those demons from the demon realm
took advantage of the situation and
corrupted all my people into dwarf
demons. Sam slammed his fist into the
stone pillar beside him, roaring, "Damn
demons! Damn Sally! I'll make them pay."
Upon hearing this, Fongu glanced at
Alpha, then quietly leaned closer to the
dog and whispered, "Did you know about
this?" Upon hearing this, Alpha
immediately shook his head, indicating
that he was completely unaware of the
matter and had no involvement
whatsoever. "Are the demon race also
part of the dark gods faction?" "Woof
woof!" Alpha barked softly while Olivia
translated. Once the demon race belonged
to the dark side. But later the demon
emperor was killed and the new demon
emperor who was also the lord of the
demon realm pius betrayed the dark god
and offered the entire demon realm to
the god realm. In exchange he gave all
the fallen angels the right to return to
the god realm. There's still this much
to it. Fongu sighed after hearing this.
Then there's no problem. Fong Yu then
turned to the golden dwarf and said,
"Taking advantage of someone's
misfortune is indeed despicable. I'm
willing to help you fight against the
demon realm." And that Titan cat named
Sally. Really? Sam was overjoyed. He
believed that with the help of the dark
gods representative, he would surely be
able to avenge his great grudge. But
let's make this clear first. You already
owe me two favors. If I add the favors
I'll do for you to deal with the demon
realm and that cat, then you'll owe me
four favors. Round it up, you owe me
four divine artifacts.
Chapter 200. The gate to the demon
realm. There are always unexpected
things that happen in this world. After
finally finding a treasure chest, it
turned out to be a deadly treasure chest
riddled with traps. And inside was a
golden dwarf, Sam the Golden Hammer, who
had been imprisoned for who knows how
many years. The key point is that this
dwarf is actually over 5 m tall. This
once again redefined Fong Yu's standard
of understanding height in this world.
Only now did he realize that humans
truly did not deserve to be described as
short. Through the Golden Dwarf's
detailed explanation, Fongu learned that
the dwarfs he was so determined to kill
were nothing more than pitiful holy
hammered dwarves who had been
assimilated by the demon race. His goal
has now changed from killing the dwarfs
to avenging the golden dwarves and
eliminating the demons who assimilated
the dwarfs. And of course, there's
catching that Titan cat. First, they had
to eliminate the real demons, which was
undoubtedly much more difficult than
eliminating the low intelligence dwarves
of the dungeons. Fongu hadn't even seen
what the so-called demon soul clan
looked like yet. So, he asked Alpha
about the demon soul clan beforehand. As
a result of Fong Yu's question, Alpha
immediately started howling excitedly
like a husky whose house had been
destroyed, barking and howling. So
Olivia had no choice but to provide
simultaneous translation for Alpha. The
Demon Soul Clan is a bunch of cowardly,
despicable, two-faced, treacherous, and
utterly dishonest demon scum. They have
defiled the noble bloodline of the demon
race. They are sinners of the demon
race. Blah blah blah. Upon hearing the
implication in Alpha's words, Fong Yu
knew that it must have had a grudge
against this demon soul clan, otherwise
it wouldn't have started cursing right
away. Can you get to the point? Fong Yu
interrupted Alpha speechlessly. Tell me
their specific abilities and weaknesses.
At this moment, the Golden Giant Sam
said, I am also quite familiar with the
demon soul race, so let me speak.
Strictly speaking, the demon soul race
cannot actually be considered the
original inhabitants of the demon realm.
They are fallen beings from the mortal
world who fled to the demon realm to
escape the pursuit of their enemies. In
this world, there are humans, elves,
orcs, and of course, there are dwarves
like us. In order to integrate into the
demon realm, they use dark secret arts
to fuse with the bloodline of the
orthodox demon race, thus creating the
demon soul race. Using dark secret
techniques to fuse with the bloodline of
the orthodox demon race, Fongu was
completely bewildered. Not only did he
fail to grasp the characteristics of the
demon soul race, but he also discovered
that the demon soul race was far more
complex than he had imagined. "In short,
they all have a mixture of attributes,
and the stronger a member of the demon
soul clan, the more complex their
bloodline. You'll see what it's like
when you see it," Sam said in a deep
voice. Fong Yu nodded and asked, "All
right, then where do we go now? Should
we look for that cat first, or should we
deal with those demon soul clan members
first?" Sam glanced at the area behind
the main hall and said, "First, I need
to get my weapons back." After saying
this, the golden dwarf placed the rat
king in his hand on his shoulder and
stroed towards the depths of the
underground palace. Taking the
opportunity, Fun Yu beckoned to Emo
Tong, Olivia, and Alpha, drawing his
three companions to his side and
whispering. "So, what do you guys think?
Is this dwarf reliable?" Olivia said
calmly. "As far as I know, dwarves love
to swear and be violent, but they rarely
lie." After pondering for a moment, the
demon vine replied, "I think with its
strength, it can completely crush us. It
shouldn't need to resort to lies to deal
with us. Alpha woof woof. Fong Yu
glanced at Olivia who then translated.
It says, "What's there to be afraid of?"
Since Guzy said he was scared of
nothing, Fong Yu<unk>s continued caution
would seem a bit cowardly. So, he had no
choice but to lead his three companions
and follow the golden dwarf deeper into
the underground palace. After walking
nearly 300 m, the magic vine reminded
Fong Yu that they had gone beyond the
range of the parasitic seed spread and
that they would likely encounter living
dwarf demons in the deeper area. Sure
enough, after walking for a while, a
dozen or so dwarf demons appeared in
front of them. When they heard the
commotion of Fong Yu and his group, the
dwarf demons initially thought they were
their companions and did not attack
them. However, to Fong Yu's surprise,
Sam the tall golden dwarf actually
walked towards the group of dwarf
demons. Let the flames purify your
bodies, my poor people. With the golden
dwarf shout, a red magic circle suddenly
appeared beneath the feet of the crypt
dwarfs, followed by a pillar of ghostly
blue fire rising from beneath each
dwarf's feet. In the blink of an eye,
before those dwarf demons could even
finish their screams, they were all
burned to ashes by the blue pillar of
fire. This Fa was stunned by what he
saw. It was the first time he had ever
seen someone release blue flame magic.
Moreover, even the dwarf demon with
extremely high fire resistance couldn't
withstand the blue flame for more than 3
seconds and turned into ashes. What kind
of divine magic is this? Fongu turned to
Olivia and asked. Olivia hesitated for a
moment, then said somewhat uncertainly,
"This seems to be a top tier fire magic
spell. The wrath of the fire god." The
golden dwarf turned to look at Olivia,
chuckled, and said, "You have some
insight. That's right. This is the wrath
of Vulcan." Fong Yu had heard Valentina
say that only mages of the arch mage
level or above could cast this top tier
magic. But the golden giant had just
released it without even chanting. "This
means that's right. I am actually a fire
elemental holy mage," Sam said in a deep
voice. "After all, as a master
blacksmith, only by using the magical
flames I summon myself can I forge the
most perfect and exquisite equipment."
At this point, Sam looked at the
gradually dying blue flames and sighed
helplessly. I never imagined that in the
end, I would have to use this magic to
purify my poor people. After saying
that, the golden dwarf continued to walk
deeper into the underground palace.
Looking at its huge and lonely figure,
Fong Yu felt a little sad. He must have
felt terrible killing these demonized
people with his own hands. Soon, the
group passed through the entire empty
underground palace hall. After burning
nearly a hundred dwarf demons along the
way, Sam led Fong Yu and the others to
the edge of a cliff, which appeared to
be a deep well dug by man. Fong Yu
looked down along the cliff and saw
rolling lava hundreds of meters below.
On the cliff were winding and rugged
walkways, and there were many huge metal
chains and pulleys embedded in the
walls. The steel cables on the pulleys
hung down and pulled giant barrels
filled with lava to a platform in the
middle of the cliff. There, the group
saw hundreds of brownskinned dwarves
busily at work. Some of the dwarves were
pulling buckets of lava into a huge
furnace, and then they began adding
other fuels to the furnace. Some dwarves
were turning over the smoking molds,
smashing them with their hammers to
extract the still red hot spears and
swords that had just taken shape. Other
dwarves then used huge iron clamps to
place these weapons onto a metal
conveyor belt and send them to the next
production line. Upon seeing this, Fong
Yu gasped and exclaimed, "This looks
like an arms factory down there. Those
dwarfves must be your people, right?"
The golden dwarf nodded solemnly and
said, "That's right. There was a large
smelting factory down here, and those
people are all my people." That's
strange. Since there are still dwarves
here, why haven't they come to the
underground palace to rescue you for so
long? Funu asked in confusion. At that
moment, Sam pointed to a spot below and
said, "Look over there. On that throne
sits that golden dwarf wearing a crown.
Doesn't it look exactly like me?" Fongu
looked in the direction Sam pointed and
saw a golden dwarf who looked almost
exactly like Sam sitting on a smaller
golden throne. He was holding a crystal
wine jug in his left hand and a shiny
pork knuckle in his right, seemingly
enjoying a hearty meal. In an instant,
Fongu understood. "So, the golden dwarf
below, who looks exactly like you, is
actually an impostor, and that impostor
has been ruling over the dwarves below."
Funu guessed. Sam nodded, speculating,
"That must be it. The demon souls are
very good at impersonating others. They
impersonated me and then tricked my
people into forging weapons for them.
Not only the one impersonating me, but
many of the dwarves among them were
fakes. At this point, Sam pointed to the
only stone staircase leading from the
underground palace to the armory below,
which had been sealed off. He gritted
his teeth in grief and said, "That
impostor of mine sealed off the passage
between the underground palace and the
lower level. Probably because he was
afraid my people would find me and
rescue me. So, what should we do?" Funu
asked. "Should we go down and kill the
demon soul clan member who is
impersonating you and expose their
conspiracy? Or do you have a better
plan?" A flash of resentment crossed the
golden dwarf's eyes as he coldly said.
The bastards of the demon soul clan must
be killed. But before that, I must kill
another bastard. As he spoke, the golden
dwarf conjured a fireball in his hand
and threw it behind the group. Under the
fireballs illumination, a black figure
flashed past, dodging the incoming
fireball. It was the Titan cat. At that
moment, the golden dwarf's eyes blazed
with fury as he looked at the Titan cat.
Sally, I can't believe you dare show
your face. Confess honestly. Are you
colluding with the demon soul clan?
After he finished speaking, three more
fireballs the size of basketball
backboards appeared above Sam's head.
With a wave of his hand, the golden
dwarf sent the three enormous fireballs
hurtling towards the Titan cat. Faced
with the three fireballs hurtling
towards it, the Titan cat showed no
panic. Everyone only felt a blur before
their eyes, and the black cat's figure
appeared dozens of meters away. At the
same time, the black cat actually spoke,
"You guessed right, you idiot." Upon
hearing this, the golden dwarf glared at
the giant cat and roared, "Do you know
what this means? You have betrayed the
dark titan. You have betrayed the dark
god." The giant cat raised its front
paw, stroked its whiskers, and said
lazily. The dark titan abandoned me, and
the dark god is about to fall, "What's
wrong with me changing masters?" Sam was
speechless after being choked by the
giant cat's words, so he asked again.
"So, you mean that when you stole my
trap box and then triggered the
mechanism to lock me in, it was all
premeditated?" The Titan cat sneered.
You're not only blindly loyal, but also
incredibly stupid. You're only realizing
this now. The golden dwarf slowly
clenched his fists, and endless anger
began to burn in his chest. Then, a
layer of flames slowly ignited on his
body, as if the god of fire had
descended to earth. Since that's the
case, then you might as well die. With
the golden dwarf's furious roar, dozens
of enormous fireballs appeared above his
head and hurled wildly at the Titan cat.
However, the Titan cat instantly
transformed into a black shadow, dodging
the dozens of fireballs and disappearing
into the darkness. Then, its shrill
voice came from the darkness. Deal with
the guests I brought before dealing with
me. As soon as the giant cat finished
speaking, Fong Yu looked down into the
giant pit and saw a vortex appearing in
the deepest lava pool. Crimson lava
continuously poured into the slowly
expanding vortex and then disappeared
into a black and red light curtain
within the vortex. Within seconds,
countless strangelooking creatures
suddenly surged out from the black and
red light curtain in the vortex, howling
as they flew towards the underground
palace above.
